body: A technic scavenger lives for the discovery of new technological wonders scraped from the depths of strange ruins, metal caverns, and outlandish junkyards. She is well-versed in all the ways that technology can be used to protect sites, as well as the ways in which it can malfunction.
name: Technic Scavenger
url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Archtypes/Technology-Themed Archetypes/Technic Scavenger

sections.body: A technic scavenger adds 1/2 her rogue level to Perception skill checks to locate mechanical or high-tech traps and to Disable Device skill checks against these traps (minimum +1). She gains Technologist as a bonus feat. She cannot use Disable Device to disarm magical traps. This ability replaces trapfinding.
sections.name: Technic Training
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Archtypes/Technology-Themed Archetypes/Technic Scavenger/Technic Training

sections.body: Starting at 4th level, whenever a technic scavenger triggers a glitch when using a timeworn technological item, she rolls twice and can choose which of the two glitch effects actually occurs. A technic scavenger always adds her level to rolls to determine what kind of glitch occurs, and treats rolls of over 100 as 100. This ability replaces uncanny dodge.
sections.name: Lucky Glitch
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Archtypes/Technology-Themed Archetypes/Technic Scavenger/Lucky Glitch

sections.body: At 8th level, a technic scavenger knows just where to strike robots to incapacitate and disable them. When she deals sneak attack damage to a robot, she ignores all hardness that robot possesses. This ability replaces improved uncanny dodge.
sections.name: Robot Slayer
